perturbation.changed_text: (i) use its reasonable efforts to remarket the Remarketing Securities deemed tendered to the Remarketing Agent in the  Remarketing pursuant to the Remarketing Procedures;
perturbation.explanation: Removing the word 'commercially' before 'reasonable efforts' introduces ambiguity regarding the standard of effort required. This could be interpreted as requiring less effort than what is commercially reasonable, potentially violating securities regulations that mandate a high standard of care in remarketing securities.
perturbation.location: Section 1. Appointment and Obligations of the Remarketing Agent. (b)

perturbation.original_text:
(b) To deliver promptly to the Remarketing Agent in New York City such number of the following documents as the Remarketing Agent shall  request:

(i) the Prospectus and any amended or supplemented Prospectus; and

(ii) any document incorporated by reference in the Prospectus (excluding exhibits thereto);

and, if the delivery of a prospectus is required at any time in connection with the Remarketing and if at such time any event shall have  occurred as a result of which the Prospectus as then amended or supplemented would include any untrue statement of a material fact or omit  to state any material fact necessary in order to make the statements therein, in the light of the circumstances under which they were made  when such Prospectus is delivered, not misleading, or if for any other reason it shall be necessary during such same period to amend or  supplement the Prospectus or to file under the Exchange Act any document incorporated by reference in the Prospectus in order to comply  with the Securities Act or the Exchange Act, to notify the Remarketing Agent and, upon its request, to file such document and to prepare  and furnish without charge to the Remarketing Agent and to any dealer in securities as many copies as the Remarketing Agent may from time  to time request of an amended or supplemented Prospectus which will correct such statement or omission or effect such compliance.
perturbation.changed_text:
(b) To deliver to the Remarketing Agent in New York City documents, as the Remarketing Agent requests:

(i) the Prospectus and any amended or supplemented Prospectus; and

(ii) any document incorporated by reference in the Prospectus (excluding exhibits thereto);

and, if the delivery of a prospectus is required at any time in connection with the Remarketing and if at such time any event may have  occurred as a result of which the Prospectus as then amended or supplemented might include statements that are potentially misleading, or if for any other reason it is somewhat necessary during such same period to amend or  supplement the Prospectus or to file under the Exchange Act any document incorporated by reference in the Prospectus in order to comply  with the Securities Act or the Exchange Act, to notify the Remarketing Agent and, upon its request, to file such document and to prepare  and furnish to the Remarketing Agent and to any dealer in securities copies of an amended or supplemented Prospectus which will address statements or omissions or effect compliance.
perturbation.explanation: The changes in language introduces ambiguity: Replacing 'promptly' with an undefined delivery timeframe; Replacing 'any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state any material fact necessary' with 'statements that are potentially misleading' reduces the standard for disclosure and creates uncertainty about what constitutes a necessary correction; Changing 'it shall be necessary' to 'it is somewhat necessary' weakens the obligation to amend or supplement the Prospectus; Replacing 'as many copies as the Remarketing Agent may from time to time request' with fewer copies, which has now been removed to introduce uncertainty about the amount of copies needed.

organization", as that term is defined by the Commission for purposes of Rule 436(g)(2) of the Securities Act (except as contemplated by clause  (ii)), (ii) no such organization shall have publicly announced or privately communicated to the Company or any Significant Subsidiary that it has  under surveillance or review, with possible negative implications, its rating of any of the Company's or any Significant Subsidiary's debt securities  or financial strength, other than any downgrade by Fitch that is consistent with its existing negative outlook and as set forth or contemplated in  each of the Time of Sale Prospectus and the Prospectus, and (iii) the Remarketing Securities shall have continued to be rated (x) by Moody's,  Investor Service, Inc., (y) by Standard & Poor's Corporate Ratings Services, and (x) by A.M. perturbation.changed_text: (k) Subsequent to the execution and delivery of this Agreement, (i) no significant downgrading should have occurred in the rating accorded the Company's or any Significant Subsidiary's debt securities or financial strength by any rating agency, (ii) no such organization should have publicly announced to the Company or any Significant Subsidiary that it might review, with vague implications, its rating of any of the Company's or any Significant Subsidiary's debt securities or financial strength, and (iii) the Remarketing Securities should be rated by a rating service.
perturbation.explanation: Replacing 'no downgrading shall have occurred' with 'no significant downgrading should have occurred' introduces ambiguity about the threshold for a downgrading that would trigger a condition failure. Changing 'under surveillance or review, with possible negative implications' to 'might review, with vague implications' weakens the notification requirement. Changing 'Moody's, Investor Service, Inc., (y) by Standard & Poor's Corporate Ratings Services, and (x) by A.M. Best Company, Inc.' to 'a rating service' eliminates the requirement for specific rating agencies to provide ratings, potentially allowing less reputable or reliable agencies to be used.
